description: [Status: stable] [Name: airflow-variable-name-task-id-mismatch] [Message: Task variable name should match the task_id: "{task_id}"] What it does Checks that the task variable name matches the task_id value for Airflow Operators. Why is this bad? When initializing an Airflow Operator, for consistency, the variable name should match the task_id value. This makes it easier to follow the flow of the DAG. Example from airflow.operators import PythonOperator incorrect_name = PythonOperator(task_id="my_task") Use instead: from airflow.operators import PythonOperator my_task = PythonOperator(task_id="my_task")
